intro: Desmos dinhensis, commonly known as the Dinh's desmos, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentamerous flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
